TopicTitle: From the far side of the world

Articles.Content: Greetings fellas, I'm nicknamed Vindicator and I'm from Argentina. I've been playing the demo for a few months and I must say I've been having a blast! (at the expense of a -few- kerbonauts). I got my payment check from work and decided that it was high time I showed my support to this marvelous and truly creative piece of work my support! So here I am, at this very moment downloading the full version after buying it! Now I can truly enjoy the wonders of kerbal space with no restrictions. I'm a teacher of English Second Language (hence my english proficiency) thus I know nothing of rocket science. But, how hard can it be?

Hi Vindicator from Argentina, welcome to the community

It's always good to see new fans of KSP, and most pilots here are like yourself, intrigued by space but not knowing much about orbital mechanics, but that's fine as KSP is such an accessible game, we can fly our craft by eye and the seat of our pants
